summary: This is an email chain between defense attorney Laura Menninger and a federal prosecutor regarding discovery issues in the US v. Maxwell case. The correspondence focuses on technical problems accessing thousands of photo and video files, discrepancies in the number of 'Highly Confidential' images, and disputes over access to nude/sexualized imagery that is not classified as child pornography.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She is corresponding with prosecutors about significant technical and procedural problems with accessing discovery materials, including images and videos from Epstein's devices.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'our client' and 'Ms. Maxwell'. The discovery issues pertain to evidence in her criminal case. She is attempting to review files from an MDC laptop.

persons.name: Chris
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a prior email exchange about partially recovered email attachments from Epstein's devices.

connections.description: Menninger is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case, as indicated by her references to 'our client' and efforts to secure discovery access.
Both are copied on the discovery correspondence as part of Maxwell's defense team.
Both are copied on the discovery correspondence as part of Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Defense Review of Evidence in New York
events.description: Laura Menninger met with prosecutors in New York to review evidence, including two hard-drives containing 'Highly Confidential' images and videos from the case.

events.title: FBI Report on Digital Evidence
events.description: An FBI report indicated approximately 33,747 'Highly Confidential' images and 895 HC videos were identified from a digital review of CART-processed evidence from Epstein's devices.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for Maxwell
events.description: The email mentions a firm trial date of November 29, 2021, for the US v. Maxwell case.

locations: Denver, CO 80203 (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman law office)
500 Pearl (presumably a government office or courthouse in New York)
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, where Maxwell was held)
keyFacts: Prosecutors initially told the defense there were approximately 2,100 'nude' or Highly Confidential images on a hard-drive from Epstein's devices, but an FBI report cited approximately 33,747 HC images and 895 HC videos, creating a major discrepancy.

The defense argues that among the 'Highly Confidential' images they reviewed, there were nude/partially-nude photos of adults but nothing they identified as meeting the legal definition of child pornography.
Thousands of photo files provided in discovery are unreadable by the defense due to incompatible file formats or corrupt files, severely impeding case preparation.
The government is refusing to provide copies of nude/sexualized images to the defense, citing a Protective Order, and will only allow in-person review under law enforcement supervision.
The email chain reveals extensive technical and procedural disputes over discovery access just months before the scheduled November 2021 trial.
